Knowledge Check

Time for a knowledge check!

What can a voter do if they make a mistake on their ballot?

    A — Nothing, they must cast their ballot as it is.
    No, try again.
    B — The voter can cross out their selection and initial next to the new choice.
    No, try again.
    C — A voter should contact an election officer, who will work with the Chief to SPOIL the ballot and issue the voter a new ballot.
    Yes, that's right!
    D — A voter should contact an election officer, who will work with the Chief to VOID the ballot.
    No, try again.

MORE INFO: (will be revealed upon selecting correct answer)

This is a test answer.

About

This website was created by the Fairfax County Office of Elections.

If you are interested in serving as an election officer, you must first apply through the Election Officer Portal.
